an5.125:1.3: BB has “one walks [for alms] at an improper time” for akalacari, referring to Snp 386 (Snp 389 on SC). There it does mean that, but why would walking for alms in the afternoon make you lose vitality? A common meaning of “akala” is “wrong time,' unseasonable”, and I think it means that here. Also, BB's 'having poor digestion' for aparinatabhoji seems to be a mistake. CPD here has 'eating unripe things'. See https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/meaning-of-apari-atabhoji/7532/3
